intro: Jatropha campestris, commonly known as the common physic nut, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, greenish fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are not suitable for human consumption. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Due to its toxic properties, it is generally avoided in gardens and landscapes.
